result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthoni Joseph Cirra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 2 days 
were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for victim listed in the criminal complaint to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint Case 16CM316 was dismissed and read in. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use of agent With Court Permission.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthoni Joseph Cirra in court with attorney Meg Colleen O'Marro.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim on 15CM1742, MB, makes statements. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty O'Marro makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements.The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 2 days)

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription, sign releases;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:victim listed in Criminal Complaint.
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $100.00 to victim listed in Criminal Complaint (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $243.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation).

CONDITION TIME: 30 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions,STAYED for use of agent with court permission.
  
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthoni Joseph Cirra in court with Attorney Meg Colleen O'Marro.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State cannot proceed to sentencing due to victims rights legislation not having been complied with as this was not scheduled for plea and sentence today.  Court adjourns for sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthoni Joseph Cirra in court with Attorney Meg Colleen O'Marro.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney O'Marro requests an adjournment so she can reach a global offer on all cases with the state.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty O'Marro.

Hearing at 03-01-2016 09:30 am

AMENDED. Atty O'Marro is now Atty of record as Atty Galang has switched law firms.

Attorney Galang requests an adjournment due to some new charges being filed.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint .  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Anthoni Joseph Cirra in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jorge Fragoso appears as friend of the court.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
